an4.169:4.1: “Mendicants, these four people are found in the world.
an4.169:4.3: One person becomes fully extinguished in the present life by making extra effort.
an4.169:4.4: One person becomes fully extinguished when the body breaks up by making extra effort.
an4.169:4.5: One person becomes fully extinguished in the present life without making extra effort.
an4.169:4.6: One person becomes fully extinguished when the body breaks up without extra effort.
an4.169:5.1: And how does a person become fully extinguished in the present life by making extra effort?
an4.169:5.2: It’s when a mendicant meditates observing the ugliness of the body, perceives the repulsiveness of food, perceives dissatisfaction with the whole world, observes the impermanence of all conditions,
an4.169:5.3: and has well established the perception of their own death.
an4.169:5.4: They rely on these five powers of a trainee:
an4.169:5.5: faith, conscience, prudence, energy, and wisdom.
an4.169:5.6: And they have these five faculties strongly:
an4.169:5.7: faith, energy, mindfulness, samādhi, and wisdom.
an4.169:5.8: Because of the strength of the five faculties, they become fully extinguished in the present life by making extra effort.
an4.169:5.9: That’s how a person becomes fully extinguished in the present life by making extra effort.
an4.169:6.1: How does a person become fully extinguished when the body breaks up by making extra effort?
an4.169:6.2: It’s when a mendicant meditates observing the ugliness of the body, perceives the repulsiveness of food, perceives dissatisfaction with the whole world, observes the impermanence of all conditions,
an4.169:6.3: and has well established the perception of one’s own death.
an4.169:6.4: They rely on these five powers of a trainee:
an4.169:6.5: faith, conscience, prudence, energy, and wisdom.
an4.169:6.6: But they have these five faculties weakly:
an4.169:6.7: faith, energy, mindfulness, samādhi, and wisdom.
an4.169:6.8: Because of the weakness of the five faculties, they become fully extinguished when the body breaks up by making extra effort.
an4.169:6.9: That’s how a person becomes fully extinguished when the body breaks up by making extra effort.
an4.169:7.1: And how does a person become fully extinguished in the present life without making extra effort?
an4.169:7.2: It’s when a mendicant … enters and remains in the first absorption … second absorption … third absorption … fourth absorption …
an4.169:7.3: They rely on these five powers of a trainee:
an4.169:7.4: faith, conscience, prudence, energy, and wisdom.
an4.169:7.5: And they have these five faculties strongly:
an4.169:7.6: faith, energy, mindfulness, samādhi, and wisdom.
an4.169:7.7: Because of the strength of the five faculties, they become fully extinguished in the present life without making extra effort.
an4.169:7.8: That’s how a person becomes fully extinguished in the present life without making extra effort.
an4.169:8.1: And how does a person become fully extinguished when the body breaks up without making extra effort?
an4.169:8.2: It’s when a mendicant … enters and remains in the first absorption … second absorption … third absorption … fourth absorption …
an4.169:8.3: They rely on these five powers of a trainee:
an4.169:8.4: faith, conscience, prudence, energy, and wisdom.
an4.169:8.5: And they have these five faculties weakly: faith, energy, mindfulness, samādhi, and wisdom.
an4.169:8.6: Because of the weakness of the five faculties, they become fully extinguished when the body breaks up without making extra effort.
an4.169:8.7: That’s how a person becomes fully extinguished when the body breaks up without making extra effort.
an4.169:8.8: These are the four people found in the world.”
